item.title: Widespread damage to road surface, 26th July
item.description:
Over the past three years there has been extensive building work in Walnut Close, including new-build and rebuilds, plus installation of two fibre-optic networks and building of the new cycleway across the entrance to the close. The building work has involve multiple movements by large and heavy vehicles; during the cycleway works contractors stored vehicles and equipment in the close for many weeks. As a result the carriageway at the entrance to Walnut Close has been severely damaged, causing issues for drivers and cyclists, and threatening the integrity of the road surface. As the county highways department, as developers of the cycleway, contributed largely to this problem please could you also remedy it asap
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Walnut Close, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kerb too high, 26th July
item.description:
When the cycleway was built last year the access to Walnut Close from Evesham Road was modified to carry the cycle path. The kerb either side of the carriageway was built too high, limiting vehicle turning in and out of the close. To date these kerbs have not been remedied which continues to cause ingress/egress issues, particularly for larger vehicles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Walnut Close, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Yellow lines mis-painted, 26th July
item.description:
During recent line repainting the double yellow lines along Evesham Road were painted across the entrance to Walnut Close. This gives the appearance that the junction is not there. Already on two occasions I have seen drivers notice the junction too late, overshoot, stop on Evesham Road then start reversing. We have had several visitors to the close complaining they missed the turning. Please could the lines be removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Walnut Close, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Huge subsidence in the road again, 25th July
item.description:
Yet again the road outside 50 Ryeworth Road is collapsing into itself. It was “repaired” a couple of years ago after a sink hole appeared and is just as bad again. I’m unable to pass this hole in the road as my car bottoms out. Please can this road defect be properly repaired rather than just patched.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, Ryeworth Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The tree on the pavement outside number 19 Chatsworth drive, GL530AG has very low hanging branches. You have to duck to walk on the pavement. Its branches are also hanging over our property (no 19) and dropping crab apples on our front garden. Can someone cut it so you don’t have to duck under it and so it doesn’t overhang or am I allowed to do it? It is growing at an angle too. The crab apples drop everywhere, making a mess of the pavement and clog the drain on the road. It also attracts a lot of wasps. Could a different tree be planted at all? If not it definitely needs straightening and cutting back., 25th July
item.description:
The tree is outside number 19.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Chatsworth Drive, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
